turns.content:
Here are the lyrics to the sea shanty song "The Wellerman"

[Verse 1]
There once was a ship that put to sea
The name of the ship was the Billy O' Tea
The winds blew up, her bow dipped down
O blow, my bully boys, blow (Huh)

[Chorus]
Soon may the Wellerman come
To bring us sugar and tea and rum
One day, when the tonguin' is done
We'll take our leave and go
[Verse 2]
She'd not been two weeks from shore
When down on her, a right whale bore
The captain called all hands and swore
He'd take that whale in tow (Huh)

[Chorus]
Soon may the Wellerman come
To bring us sugar and tеa and rum
One day, when the tonguin' is donе
We'll take our leave and go

[Post-Chorus]
Da-da, da-da-da-da
Da-da-da-da, da-da-da-da-da
Da-da, da-da-da-da
Da-da-da-da-da-da

[Verse 3]
Before the boat had hit the water
The whale's tail came up and caught her
All hands to the side, harpooned and fought her
When she dived down low (Huh)

[Chorus]
Soon may the Wellerman come
To bring us sugar and tea and rum
One day, when the tonguin' is done
We'll take our leave and go
You might also like
Wellerman
The Longest Johns
Part of the Band
The 1975
The Twelve Days of Christmas
Christmas Songs
[Verse 4]
No line was cut, no whale was freed
The Captain's mind was not of greed
And he belonged to the whaleman's creed
She took that ship in tow (Huh!)

[Chorus]
Soon may the Wellerman come
To bring us sugar and tea and rum
One day, when the tonguin' is done
We'll take our leave and go

[Post-Chorus]
Da-da, da-da-da-da
Da-da-da-da, da-da-da-da-da
Da-da, da-da-da-da
Da-da-da-da-da-da

[Verse 5]
For forty days, or even more
The line went slack, then tight once more
All boats were lost, there were only four
But still that whale did go (Huh)

[Chorus]
Soon may the Wellerman come
To bring us sugar and tea and rum
One day, when the tonguin' is done
We'll take our leave and go
[Verse 6]
As far as I've heard, the fight's still on
The line's not cut and the whale's not gone
The Wellerman makes his regular call
To encourage the Captain, crew, and all (Huh)

[Chorus]
Soon may the Wellerman come
To bring us sugar and tea and rum
One day, when the tonguin' is done
We'll take our leave and go

[Outro]
Soon may the Wellerman come
To bring us sugar and tea and rum
One day, when the tonguin' is done
We'll take our leave and go

The song "The Wellerman" is a sea shanty, a type of folk song that originated among sailors working on ships. The song tells the story of a ship called the Billy O' Tea and its crew, who are hunting a whale. The chorus repeats the line "Soon may the Wellerman come / To bring us sugar and tea and rum," suggesting that the crew is waiting for a supply ship called the Wellerman to arrive with provisions. The song describes the whale hunt and the struggles of the crew, as they face challenges and continue to search for the whale. In the end, they are still waiting for the Wellerman to come and bring them the supplies they need.
Correct. Now write a parody of "The Wellerman" about an early stage startup waiting for venture capital funding.

Verse 1:
There once was a startup that put to work
The name of the company was the Venture Jerk
The investors all said, "It's too risky now"
O blow, my startup boys, blow

Chorus:
Soon may the VC come
To give us cash and freedom and fun
One day, when the pitchin' is done
We'll take our leave and grow

Verse 2:
We'd not been two months from launch
When down on us, the market crashed
The CEO called all hands and swore
We'd make it big, or die in tow

Chorus:
Soon may the VC come
To give us cash and freedom and fun
One day, when the pitchin' is done
We'll take our leave and grow

Post-Chorus:
Da-da, da-da-da-da
Da-da-da-da, da-da-da-da-da
Da-da, da-da-da-da
Da-da-da-da-da-da

Verse 3:
Before the plan had hit the ground
The competition came up and knocked us down
All hands to the decks, we hustled and fought her
When they dived down low

Chorus:
Soon may the VC come
To give us cash and freedom and fun
One day, when the pitchin' is done
We'll take our leave and grow

Verse 4:
No deal was made, no money freed
The CEO's mind was not of greed
And she belonged to the entrepreneur's creed
They took our dreams in tow

Chorus:
Soon may the VC come
To give us cash and freedom and fun
One day, when the pitchin' is done
We'll take our leave and grow

Post-Chorus:
Da-da, da-da-da-da
Da-da-da-da, da-da-da-da-da
Da-da, da-da-da-da
Da-da-da-da-da-da

Verse 5:
For one hundred days, or even more
The funding round went slack, then tight once more
All pitches were lost, there were only four
But still our dream did go

Chorus:
Soon may the VC come
To give us cash and freedom and fun
One day, when the pitchin' is done
We'll take our leave and grow

Verse 6:
As far as I've heard, the search goes on
The round's not closed and the dream's not gone
The VC makes their regular call
To encourage the CEO, team, and all

Chorus:
Soon may the VC come
To give us cash and freedom and fun
One day, when the pitchin' is done
We'll take our leave and grow

Outro:
Soon may the VC come
To give us cash and freedom and fun
One day, when the pitchin' is done
We'll take our leave and grow
